message_1: Suppose you want to send the word "MATH" using a one-time pad encryption. The pad you will use has the following random sequence of numbers: 18, 2, 1, 7. Convert the letters of the word "MATH" to their corresponding alphabetical position (e.g. A=1, B=2, ..., Z=26) and add the numbers from the one-time pad to each letter (mod 26) to obtain the encrypted message. What is the encrypted message?
message_2:
First, we need to convert the letters of the word "MATH" to their corresponding alphabetical positions:

M = 13
A = 1
T = 20
H = 8

Now, we add the numbers from the one-time pad to each letter (mod 26):

M (13) + 18 = 31 (mod 26) = 5
A (1) + 2 = 3 (mod 26) = 3
T (20) + 1 = 21 (mod 26) = 21
H (8) + 7 = 15 (mod 26) = 15

Now, we convert the resulting numbers back to their corresponding letters:

5 = E
3 = C
21 = U
15 = O

So, the encrypted message is "ECUO".
